page.title: 16Gourdon Dialect
page.content: The origin of the name of Gourdon possibly derives from the Gaelic. Probably goats grazed on the Gourdon slopes long ago and the name means "Goat-hill". In the early 14th century the name{"Gurden"}appears as a farm and fisher town. There are in fact at least 8 different ways of spelling the name in old documents, maps, newspapers and tombstones. The form of spelling was to become standardised about 200 years ago to its present form, with non residents pronouncing the village name as Gourdon whilst villagers to this day continue to use the ancient form of Gurden. The villagers are still very apt in their choice of nick names for local residents especially amongst the fishing fraternity.
